page.title: 14Housing in the Uzmaston area
page.content: Uzmaston (once a hamlet) has in 1985 over 200 households with a population of 500+. Near the Church are a few 3 or 4 room cottages (rented or provided with employment) and 8 Council Houses built post 1945 for agricultural workers (6 of Airey construction) overlooking the Village Green. On Uzmaston and New Roads houses and bungalows are generally larger, averaging 7 rooms, built between 1900 and 1984. An estate of about 80 detached homes, (varied in design and owner occupied) has been built during the last decade on Bethany Fields. Along Cartlett, near the Station, are older properties, some with 10+ rooms. Bethany Row houses on A.40 are being reconstructed and modernised. Farm- -houses date from the last century or earlier. Most exteriors are roughcast and white or pastel coloured.
